longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of temporary or emergency passports. 
Admission and Transit Restrictions:
- Admission and transit refused to visitors, arriving from
  Nigeria. 

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for holders
of normal, emergency or temporary passports issued to
nationals of Nigeria . 
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold documents required for their
  next destination.
  
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age.
Warning:
- Visitors and residents of Cameroon must hold a certificate
  of polio vaccination. Those not holding a certificate of
  vaccination will receive a dose of oral polio vaccine (OPV)
  on arrival. 
Recommended:
- Vaccination against yellow fever for all passengers.
  Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists throughout the year in the whole country.
  Recommended prevention: C.
